[[File:RYAKUJI ki.png|thumb|right|100px|{{w|Ryakuji}} for 器.]]

subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|grade=4|rs=口13|kyu=器}} <!-- Note: Kyūjitai form is 器 (U+FA38) -->

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=o|き}} * When used as a suffix, the resulting term has a [[downstep]] either right before, or one [[mora]] before, the ''ki''. :* If the preceding syllable has only one mora (as in ''ga'' or ''tsu''), the downstep occurs just after that mora: ::: {{m|ja|瓦器||unglazed earthenware}}: {{ja-accent/down|が}}{{lang|ja|き}} [gáꜜkì] ::: {{m|ja|空気予熱器|tr=kūki yonetsuki||air pre-heater}}: {{lang|ja|く}}{{ja-accent/high|うきよね}}{{ja-accent/down|つ}}{{lang|ja|き}} [kùúkí yónétsúꜜkì] :* If the preceding syllable has two [[morae]] (as in ''zen'' or ''tei''), the downstep occurs between the two morae: ::: {{l|ja|安全器|tr=anzenki||safety cut-out}}: {{lang|ja|あ}}{{ja-accent/high|ん}}{{ja-accent/down|ぜ}}{{lang|ja|んき}} [àńzéꜜǹkì] ::: {{l|ja|円弧測定器|tr=enko sokuteiki||cyclometer}}: {{lang|ja|え}}{{ja-accent/high|んこそく}}{{ja-accent/down|て}}{{lang|ja|いき}} [èńkó sókútéꜜèkì]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Often used interchangeably with {{m|ja|機|tr=ki}} in compounds to indicate “machine”, with the subtlety that {{lang|ja|器}} implies a smaller device, perhaps hand-held, while {{ja-l|機}} implies a larger machine, such as an airplane. Compare {{m|ja|食器|tr=shokki||tableware}} and {{m|ja|飛行機|tr=hikōki||airplane}}, or [[homophone]]s {{m|ja|機械|tr=kikai||machine|pos=generally larger}} and {{m|ja|器械|tr=kikai||machine, tool|pos=generally smaller}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|器%物|うつわ%もの}}: a [[container]]; [[ability]], [[talent]]; a [[musical instrument]]
